snippet: In some states, campaign cash from sophisticated donor networks has helped accelerate or arrest the natural drift toward one party or the other, defying national election trends and voter registration advantages.
abstract: Campaign cash from sophisticated donor networks for both Republicans and Democrats has helped remake the nation's political landscape, defying national election trends and voter registration advantages in some states; 23 states are now solely controlled by Republicans and 13 solely by Democrats (Series: One-Party Rule).

byline.contributor: Sarah Cohen and Monica Davey contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In some states, campaign cash from sophisticated donor networks has helped accelerate or arrest the natural drift toward one party or the other, defying national election trends and voter registration advantages.

headline.main: A National Strategy Funds State Political Monopolies
headline.print_headline: A National Strategy Funds State Political Monopolies

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
